reviewText: Ordered these to go with the Puppy Paws Harnesses.  They are wider than the harnesses, which I didn't expect.  Would have been better if they were the same width.  All in all, they are sturdy and work fine.

I was very much desperate when I started looking for a anti itch remedy for my cat, and dog. My dog has severe allergies, and he has to be bathed in zymox, almost once every two weeks. Already gone through the diet changes, and stuff. I recently noticed that both pets were scratching more frequent, and losing hair. So I went on the hunt. Reading the reviews, I began to think possibly there skin was dry, because they both are indoor pets; with the exception of my dog going out to be excused several times a day. And now it is winter, and the central heat is a dry circulating heat.The first bath participant was my short haired petite cat. It usually takes about 10 or more minutes to bathe her thoroughly anyhow. Which makes the manu- directions of letting the product stay on, at least 10 minutes, worked out fine. I usually bathe at night; to give her skin time to recover the rest of the night; then the effects of the product will be made known immediately, when she wakes up the next day. So the next morning, no crazy scratching, nor pulling her hair. This stuff worked so well, I bathed my dog the next night. Using the same technique; letting the shampoo stay on for 10 minutes. This was the only shampoo that has given both my precious pets relief.I did notice that my dog started scratching again, a few days later. So I decided to reapply the water, and Epi shampoo on a cloth, but only on his hot spots. I did this while he was lying on the bed. I let this solution, soak in approx 30 minutes, while he ran, and played, inside the house. Then rinsed him off in the bathtub. That application really did the job. He is so happy, and jolly not having to stop playing, just to scratch. He used to wake up with a violent itch, and I knew it was not from fleas, nor bacterial infection, because the Zymox would take care of that. We all are so pleased with this product.Recently tried Palma castor oil on their skin as well. It works great for dry skinThanks to all reviewers who do take the time to share honest testimonials of how a product has worked for them, or for their wonderful pets. It really is appreciated.

It last a little longer than I expected.  I have a dog that gets hold of toys and rips at them until she has all the stuffing or whatever out of them.  She is only 17 lbs and no toy has ever stood up to her, but it did take her a couple of days to finish off this one.
My taste tester, Bob, rejected this cat food. He is very picky so know that there's a chance you've purchased a whole case of wasted food. I donate, not waste, however.

A cat adopted my back yard.  He has decided he wants to hang around.  I am not a cat person...but this little fella is great cat.  I have purchased 4 different houses for him....But NNOOOOOOOOOO he likes none of them.  I saw this one and thought I would give it one last try. Winter is approaching and I want the little guy BYC (back yard cat) to be safe and warm.  I purchased this and he has actually been using it. He seems to like it alot.  Gives me some peace of mind that he has some warmth and safety. Would  highly recommend this kitty tube!

reviewText: We have a basset hound that sheds quite a bit.  Our micro fiber couch that holds onto lots of his fur.  We've tried the Pledge fabric sweeper, Bissel Pet hair vacuum,rubber gloves, lint rollers and numerous other things to try to remove his fur.  This is the only product that works on this fabric.  The refills are pricey at the store for how many we need to clean a couch, ottoman and arm chair.  These are a great bargain.
summary: Only thing that works on our couch

reviewText: I make my own dog food for my three dogs, but the shelter dogs just don't have that luxury until they are adopted.  I donate this to many shelters to nourish the dogs as best they can in the interim time before they are adopted.  I seriously doubt the ingredients are quality enough that I would regularly feed my pup, but many shelters are quite happy with Pedigree.  It is better than many foods out there and I would rather donate this than some cheap supermarket food.  ...Plus, it is donated with much love and good intentions.
summary: I Donate this Pedigree to the Shelter

reviewText: My corgi loves it. He dived right in and got all comfy when I first showed it to him. It is the right size for him. The main pillow part of the bed fits snuggly inside the outer shell and can pull right out. My dog has always loved to stick his nose as deep as possible into the crevices of his previous dog bed and this one has much bigger and better ones.The bed is surprisingly heavy and solidly built (in Montana, no less). The outer cotton fabric is thick and high quality. I am hoping it stands up to my dog chewing it, though, like he did the last bed, which broke through. The stuffing is plentiful and made from old plastic soda bottles. I can't see the material itself, but it does seem resilient and "slippery." The stuffing provides a high fluff that gets flattened out not too much after the dog sleeps on it a bit.I, and my dog, am initially very pleased with the size, design and quality of this bed. I will follow up later after it gets used more, but from what I've seen, this is a very good product.Update Dec.31, 2011: After several months of daily use, it has settled in to a nice, comfy condition. The original high fluff mode has gotten tramped down, but not so that it is hard. It is still very comfy. Washing the bottom cushion was easy and had no problems.
Awesome item, wish they made them for small dogs. Would have been great for camping with our schnauzer. Had to return it though.
summary: Had a dumb moment and didn't notice the size

reviewText: I have recently bought a second fountain, one upstairs and one downstairs. I have used fountains before and the cats loved the. I have four cats and all use these, especially durning the hot weather. I I have had them for several months and no problems I have not had to replace the filters yet so like that they too seem to last. The multi tier unit is great as the cats drink from all three tiers and each has their favorite spot. Sometimes two drink together on different tiers. I refill daily with 6-8 oz of water so I know they are using these regularly along with other water bowls I provide.
All of our cats have always been crazy about these treats. They like other treats, but they will beg and plead for these. Definitely their favorites!

I'd give it 5 stars, but I keep waiting to see reviews that tell me that this thing makes your plants get completely out of control, which is what I want.  I've had the standard stupid tubes for decades, and thought I'd give this a chance after trying out the little 11" ones.  It's worth the money.  The effects and the lighting itself are very nice.  I have this on my 72 bowfront, and I'm going to buy the 36-48" and put it in front of this one.  My plants haven't really changed much since I installed this light, but once I buy the 2nd one, I'll know for sure in a several weeks.These are really nice.  Why a company like Marineland doesn't have a separate switch/setting/timer for the blue lights, I have no idea.  I run my lights past bed time, so during the actual night, it would be nice to have the moon lights on instead of no light at all.  (I DO have the 11" versions, two of them, set for blue only, but it's not worth spending the extra money just for that.)  I like it enough to buy another, and the overall reviews that I've read are very good.
Has a nice heft but isn't too heavy, and it's flexible, so it won't hurt your pet.  Very durable too.

My dog seems to like the feel of it as this is the only brush he doesn't run away from (hates being brushed). On the other hand, it attracts practically no hair. It's basically a massage brush for the dog.

So happy I ordered the Heartbeat Pillow for our new pup because although she has not cried one night since her arrival (which is very unusual for a new pup), she likes this toy and keeps it in her exercise pen near her bed and rug.  This pillow and her large stuffed dog seem to be cuddle objects that bring her comfort. Sometimes she chews on this pillow but mostly uses it as a pillow.  I would order this again and yes, I would also recommend it to my family and friends for their new pup.  I ordered this pillow along with other pup toys and they all arrived in very good condition and within a couple days after I placed my order.Update:Our pup is now 8 months old and still loves to carry her Heartbeat Pillow around and sleep with it.  The stuffed dog that was once adored and used as a snuggle-up got the stuffing knocked out of it.  The Heartbeat Pillow is still beating but worn in several spots and will be replaced with my next order.

reviewText: Love the color and that its reflective. The color stands out more so people will notice my pup is a boy not a girl

I continue to use this for my dog just incase it is helping him but I am not sure. I like that it has no chemicals that can harm him.

reviewText: My dog is 150 English Mastiff who is a very picky eater. He will ONLY eat Grammy's pot pie. While the last batch we got from Amazon seemed a little more watered down and less meaty than the rest of them, our dog is a grammy's pot pie addict and we are trying to stock up in case of an emergency. We have tried other food and he really doesn't like it. He also has a very sensitive stomach and throws up with most food, but not with Grammys. I am hoping we just got a bad batch of grammy's this time around and they haven't permanently watered it down. I will update with the next case we go through. I would have to lower my stars if that was the case unfortunately.

This thing has saved my back. I have a 55g and a 29g, along with some nano tanks. I've been hauling around a 5g bucket for years and finally I can do water changes without spilling a drop. It's a wonderful, wonderful investment. I wish I'd bought it years and years ago. If you have a large tank, or even a medium-sized tank, this thing is a godsend. Not worth it for a nano tank.My only complaint, and the only reason I haven't given it five stars, is because of its tendency to kink. Once the plastic has kinked, it's hard to get it to un-kink. Winding it up is infuriating. Sometimes the kinks interfere with the suction.Despite that flaw, it's been a lifesaver and I will never go without one again.
summary: Can't live without it; tendency to kink

reviewText: This is a nifty item to have!A collapsible travel bowl that can clip on to a belt, leash or bag or slip into a purse and then pop open at a moment's notice. Whether you are hiking, on a car trip or just going down to the dog run, having an easy to pack, lightweight water (or food) bowl can come in very handy.Made of tough, rugged but easily cleaned, plastic, the bowl pops open, accordian-like in two stages to form a shallow and then when fully opened, deep container.A sturdy metal clip allows the bowl to be attached to anything necessary.The large size has a two cup capacity. The small sizePopware for Pets Travel Cup, Small, Pinkholds one cup. Both sizes come in two colors: bright pink and in turquoise.As far as I'm concerned, the pink is irrisistable!These flat bottomed containers are solid and rugged but I wouldn't recommend using them as permanent pet feeding bowls. These are collapsable and are meant for travel or use for temporary situations.Also, anyone can use these bowls, hikers, campers, kids sitting in the back seat of a car.....not just dogs!
summary: Difficult To Find Collapsible Travel Bowl

reviewText: I should have asked my family to buy and or look at these products in the pet store, but they weren't home...since I am disabled and can't go out--I rely on amazon and reviews.I should have double checked first before springing for this obvious chemical spray.  there's a LOT of warning labels on proper disposals and calling waste management.  if this WERE a true natural product, why the warning labels?I am disappointed by this "natural" spray.  I won't buy this stuff ever again.oh worst part is, the packages kept leaking like crazy, making it all the more difficult to use.  if I want a more natural product, I am going to do some more thorough research next time out.  I won't be killing my babies with chemicals.
This works FAST so careful easy to overdo your pups paws. This is great and leaves a smooth flawless finish.

This litter really works as described.  It draws the moisture out of the feces so well that cleaning the box is a breeze - no more gooey mess on the cleaning shovel when they have sensitive stomachs.  I can't even tell when they've peed unless I happen to go into the laundry room right after they've gone.  We've been able to get 6-8 weeks out of the litter with two cats - one a 15 pounder.We were using more conventional clumping litter but got a dog who likes to eat the cats' poo and the traditional clumping litter is dangerous to dogs who have this habit.  This litter draws away moisture to make it easy to clean versus coating with litter that clumps onto the pieces so they can be scooped out.

This is a well formulated pellet for for guinea pigs, though the size and shape of the pellets make my guinea pigs not want to eat it for some reason. I had switched to this because I found stuff like pretzels and seeds in the other guinea pig food I had been buying - and looked up that those were not good for pigs(well, obviously not the pretzels....that made me look for new food) and found this one.I just wish the size of the pellets were bigger or more varied so my guinea pigs would like it.

My cats will eat this cat food, which is always the first battle.  They don't go crazy for it, but are agreeable.  I like the pleasant odor of the food, and am pleased the two top ingredients are protein sources.  I feel good feeding it to two of my cats, although I don't use dry food as a sole source of nutrition, as the protein just doesn't seem high enough for my little carnivores.  In addition, I cannot feed this to my diabetic cat, as it raised his blood sugar too high.  I was hopeful since it is labelled low glycemic carbs, but I guess  there are just too many for my special kitty.  It's good to remember that although they sound like healthy ingredients, and for us humans they are, cats dont need grains like oatmeal or vegetables in their diet, and they are usually added to keep the price down, not keep the cat at it's best.  That being said, this food seems better than a lot of others on the market today, and like I said...they will eat it.
summary: Nutience Natural Healthy Adult Cat Food

reviewText: I was first looking for something to help my dog cope with its separation anxiety... So when I saw all positive comments here I rushed to buy one!Well.... until today I am not sure if it is working or not! My dog naturally is very hyper and distracted. With the shirt on, sometimes she gets very calm and sometimes it seems like she is as crazy as usual. To be honest, it seems like the effect is a little bit too inconsistent for me, and that is the reason I am giving a 3 out of 5 stars! Maybe the effect is just too mild or maybe I was just expecting too much of this product!The product itself is of very good quality and fits great!It wasn't for me but perhaps it would work better on your dog! Worth a try!
summary: Maybe it works, maybe it doesn't!!!

reviewText: Kibbles are about the size of peas. Great for putting in toys for treats as well! Bag is re-seal able!Been using this for a week now. Mixing 1/4 cup into my puppy's current food. She will usually eat half of her food then come up to me and "thank me" as if she was seeing me after being gone for a few hours. She then runs back and continues eating her food. Since mixing this, she will pick out these food first, and then leave her old food in her dish. When she thanks me she isn't as happy returning to eat her old food to finish off her meal.Update after :Take 2 weeks or longer in transitioning of your food!!!!!! I did only 10 days, and it wasn't enough.Well with the amount of food I had left I was only able to mix her food for 10 days. That IS NOT ENOUGH TIME to let her stomach adjust!!!!!!!!!! I watched her for the first week and she had a extremely soft stool! So much so, that I started to watch her water intake and if she changed in her speed in eating as if she knew it would upset her stomach but she remained a happy playful puppy. I also regulated her treats. It took about 10 days for her stool to start having any shape to it, and about 2-3 weeks after the full change over of the food her stools became solid and normal. I second the less bowel movements that everyone else has said, so for those of you who have to scoop, this would be beneficial to you. I have 2 acres, and mine insists on running 20 yards into the woods, so that was something I was glad I didn't have to train her to do. She goes in the morning and in the evening, and her stool quantity is half what it was with her Purina. She was doing fine on that, but figured I'd try something better. If you pay just a little bit more for this food, and she eats it over a longer period of time it all equals out in the end. I think I feed her less than the chart says, but I know she is full  when she comes in from going out an hour after she eats and hides her treat somewhere in the house (on top of her bed, in the corner of a step going up to the bedroom, and her favorite spot is here on the couch behind me skillfully digging and burying it behind me). I adjusted her meal size because it seemed the very little last bit she was not wanting to eat, and would walk away and come thank me for her food more and more. Since I've cut back on the food, she will come and thank me at least once while she eats but no more than that. She is gaining weight, and not chunky either. I don't know if it was a warm spell that we had, mid 30's-40's for 2 weeks in Dec, or the change over from food, or maybe shedding from puppy coat to normal hair but she did have some major shedding going on for a week or so. No globs coming out and when I used a brush on her not much hair now. I do not brush her daily anymore, the brush is the vacuum's little cousin I guess. Her coat is nice and silky to the touch.Also, I live in Alaska, and use the wood stove as my primary heat. I usually put 2-3 gal of water in the humidifier each day. With the Purina, she was scratching quite a bit, so much that I started adding a teaspoon of olive oil in with each meal. That helped her with that and she itched less, but never stopped. I think I may notice her scratch 2-3 times a day and it doesn't seem to be as focused and intense as it was before. It could be that she is just getting use to it up here as well, but there is a lot to be said for a healthy diet in humans. It is just the same for our pets.I have been trying to keep a 0700 and 1700 feeding time. I don't have her sitting at my feet a hour in advance doing her I'm hungry dance. There are times where I am working on something on the house and it will be almost 1900, and she is still just hanging out with me as normal not begging for anything. So I would think that would mean that she is content from the previous feeding, and that I have her food amount adjust pretty close to what it should be.One down fall of the small kibbles... when put in a feeding toy that they have to roll around to get food... the food comes out and goes under doors, edges of furniture. If your pet is aggressive, this could lead to holes pawed in carpet etc, I just have to sit and listen to non stop constant barking all over one morsel that has went under the laundry room door. She still has half a toy full of food, but she will not let even one get away.Second edit:I don't know if I my dog has started to have allergies or not. I have become fed up with her shedding more than a heeler should. I have switched to taste of the wild, bison, and well we are working through things and are getting her tested for other allergies. I will say this. Put a bowl of TOTW down and a bowl of wellness, the bowl of wellness will be left alone. The prices are about the same, but overall I think they are both better than cheap brand dog foods, but mine seems to have changed. I have since got a second red heeler female pup, and she finished off the half bag of what I had left with no issues what so ever, but she sure was interested in the smells coming from the other food bowl.
Hey I know my dog chews things that's why I got him this. But he really chewed through it faster than his other toys. If you have a dog that likes to chew this isn't your best bet.

This pet scratch protection film comes in a big roll and looks somewhat like packaging tape. However it's a thicker piece of plastic that can protect against pet claw scratches. The roll contains a 15 feet of the film and it can be cut to any length you want. It's also 3 inches wide but you can cut it into a thinner strips if needed. It's very easy to apply. First you thoroughly clean the area that you plan on covering with the film. Then pull a section off the roll and cut it to size with a box cutter or a pair of scissors. Then carefully line it up and push it smoothly into place. You will want to smooth out and remove and air bubbles for best results. It will provide a durable and long lasting barrier to protect against cat or dog scratches. It works very well but I would highly suggest not applying it to painted wood. When we have visitors over we will typically lock our dogs in our bedroom because they bark non-stop and annoy our guests. They like to claw at the bedroom door when they want out and they have scratched a section of the paint off. I installed a couple strips of this protection film to the area which should do a good job of preventing additional damage. However I noticed if I would pull the film back up after applying it that much of the paint comes up with it. As a result when I eventually remove the film I will have to repaint the door. You should be fine using it on any baseboards, window seals or door frames.
summary: Works well but be careful what you apply it to because it may pull of paint when you eventually remove it

My cat took to the Feline Pine pellets without any problem, but he's never been finicky about his litter box. We use them in the Booda Dome Cleanstep Cat Box (which I also really like), and I love that this litter doesn't turn into cement in the corners and bottom of the box like every other litter I've tried. I've used clay, wheat, corn, walnuts, and recycled paper, and this is the best in my opinion.Like others have said, Feline Pine Original comes in pellets that dissolve and turn into sawdust when they get wet. You then scoop out the sawdust and any poop, leaving the whole pellets in the box. It took a little time to come up with a system for using this litter in a regular litter box (as opposed to a sifting litter-box), but it's easy now. I have an extra plastic tub with a lid (that I saved from the TidyCats litter that I tried to use a long time ago), and that's where I keep a sifting litter scoop and a regular solid scoop (the solid scoop that I use is the Pureness 1-Cup Food Scoop that Amazon sells for less than a dollar, and it works just fine). When I'm cleaning the litter-box, I remove the tools from the TidyCat container and use them to move the solid waste from the litter-box into the TidyCats waste container. Then, I remove the sawdust from the box. I do this by pushing all the litter to one side of the litter-box and taking large scoops of the litter and "sifting" the sawdust into the TidyCats waste container. I then put the clean pellets back into one side of the litter-box and continue until I've sifted through all of it and am left with only clean pellets. Then, I dispose of everything in the TidyCats waste container, and put the scoops back in it for storage. I post this is an extremely long description of how I clean a litter-box, only because I was really tempted to buy a sifting litter-box just to use the Feline Pine. Then, I came up with this method, which is easy and allows me to keep using the Booda Dome Cleanstep Cat Box, which I really love.I like Feline Pine Original because it *doesn't* clump and turn into a sticky mess, and I feel like the cat box overall is cleaner because it doesn't have remnants cemented to the inside. The waste sawdust cleans up very easily. I also like that it controls urine odor better than any other cat litter I've used and it's unscented. Because it's unscented, it doesn't mask poop odor, so if you're right on top of the litter box, you'll smell a fresh poop for a few minutes, but the sawdust that forms when the pellets get wet helps to cover up the poop and dry it out so that it doesn't continue to stink.Before switching to Feline Pine, I was using the Blue Buffalo Naturally Fresh made from walnuts, and for odor control that would still be my second choice. However, the Feline Pine is still much cleaner and it is totally dust-free.

I would have given this litter pan 5 stars if it weren't that clasps do not tie upper and bottom parts together.  So really you can't use the handle to move it, since it comes apart.  Otherwise it is a nicely-sized box.

I have used Frontline for years, and in the last 4 or 5,it is different.  It doens't work as well as it once did, and I lost a cat because of it.  She had symptoms of poison.  The vet suggested it might be antifreeze.  I live in the country with no home nearby, and how many actually put antifreeze in their own vehicles nowadays?  My dog had a seizure and it took reading this discussion to figure out it was Frontline all along, poisoning my pets!!  I thought my dog just old, but in retrospect, each time I put it on him he reacted quickly with the seizures and throwing up.  Thanks to everyone posting on Amazon discussions about the dangers of Frontline! I don't want to put even one star on this rating but it makes me before it will post..

summary: Wonderful product. Won't buy anything else.

reviewText: This is popular with my dogs. I bought this for my larger dog and the deer antler for my smaller. Though the deer antler is more popular with my dogs they still enjoy chewing this one as well.

i have these 2 and i am impressed greatly by them. i had to aquaclear 50's and they were strong but nowhere near these.. and for the flow and price best decision i made i think ive had them for 2 months and doing great. only thing that would have made this deal better is if they came with the reducer to have a more direct flow. great product for the money. i dont have any corrals or anemones yet but when i feed my fish the food gets pushed everywhere and and the fish catch like lil waves in the tank so try and catch it.
Stainless steel bowls are great. The base is made of a plastic. I am a little bit nervous that my new puppy will chew this plastic, but will see.
I love it and so does my Jack Russell. It took him a little while to get use to something on his back. He wears it with pride that he is helping now!
My cats love it. It is very entertaining to watch them play with. It stays on for fifteen minutes of continuous kitty fun.

I've raised...oh, LOTS of bottle kittens.  Every spring I swear I'm going to take a year off from fostering and catch up on my sleep, then the shelter calls and I know that they have to euthanize healthy kittens if they don't have enough foster homes, so I wind up with several litters anyways.I've tried an assortment of foods to wean my kittens onto, and this one is the one that consistently agrees with everyone, it's also one that they all seem to enjoy eating.  It agrees with the digestion of very sensitive tummies.  Right now I have a four week old kitten who started out on a chicken and rice formula canned food, and she kept vomiting up the rice.  Blech!  I switched her to Babycat and she dove in face-first and ate a TON of food, which has been staying down since the switch.I'm an ingredient nut when it comes to pet food most of the time, BUT there are some foods that just WORK, even if the ingredients make me cringe a little.  I prefer to get my kittens started on Babycat and transition them to a different brand once they are well established.
summary: The best food to start weaning kittens onto!

reviewText: I originally purchased this food when my dog was having a dry skin issue and didn't like the fish oil I purchased. By using the wet food to help disguise the fish oil she was eating just fine.  With the exception of the beef she really loves this food.

If your cat is skilled enough to keep the litter flinging to a minimum, this thing will catch it. But if your cat has a big smelly poop and is overly self conscious about it and they work really hard to bury that nasty pickle, there may be litter flying everywhere. Put it in the right place and it will work. But get your aim wrong and you'll still have a mess. After the incident just take this thing out to the garbage can and give it a shake. Then over to the hose and go OCD on it and it will be fresh as a daisy. The only thing I don't like about it is the color. Let's think outside the litter box and offer some more interesting colors, maybe even stripes or patterns. This tan doesn't match anything, certainly not litter or small poops.

A regular leash is hard on my hands. This product has a very comfortable, slightly spongy grip that stays straight, does not give and collapse on your hand. Very nice for my arthritic hands. Very strong, works well for my Rottweiler.
summary: Helps you if you have arthritis in your hands

reviewText: This whistle is what we've been needing to work with our dog.  It is small enough to carry on my keyring and loud enough that the dog takes notice when we blow it.  Good purchase.
came apart in no time. I supervise my dog with this tossing to her playing, it came apart from the pressure of her teeth sinking into it. It simply split in half.

My dog has color dilution allopecia, so his fur is thin and his skin is very sensitive. He had issues with dry skin and minor skin infections for a long time, but since switching to this food his skin and coat have been much healthier. He doesn't shed as much as he used to, and his fur is softer. He also loves the food, he'll work for individual kibbles as if they were treats!
summary: Great for my dog's sensitive skin

reviewText: I bought this for my Aunt's cocker spaniel.  When I visited last month, it was apparent the dog loved this toy.  We filled it with kibble many times, and the dog would keep playing with it every time we filled it.  It is made of a soft rubber-like material, so it is probably not the best toy for aggressive chewers.

Our dog has to take medication daily for his allergies.  These pill pockets do a fabulous job of disguising his tablets.  Just insert the tablet and "mold" the pocket around it, works better than cheese.  The Duck and Pea flavor is suitable for dogs with allergies.  Our dog is a big Greenies fan, so he just thinks he's getting an extra treat.  Great product!

The ScoopFree Anti Tracking Carpet works pretty well, although I still end up with a lot of crystals on the floor.  However, one of my cats (a 13 pound Tom) really gets crazy with the litter. I think if it were just my two girls using it, nearly all the litter would be captured on the mat.  If I knew that just my two girls were going to use the system, I would definitely buy this again.As to other reviewers' comments, I did NOT notice a funny smell, and it's true that it's hard to get the crystals out, even with a vacuum.  Alas, even with the great, great ScoopFree Automatic Litterbox, there are no perfect solutions for indoor cats.

I was looking for a "luxury" play tunnel for my buns.  I had a new foster bun and she didn't have a tunnel to play in :(.  I had one like t his before for my recently adopted foster bun but I gave it to the new adopter so he would feel comfortable in his new home with his old tunnel/his scent.  I loved this tunnel since it was made well and very long in length.  I have some tunnels currently that I bought at a local pet supply store and they were much much shorter and not as much fun!  I love the leopard print and it is soft too.  the bun(s) like to fly through this and often times they just stick their heads out!  They have a blast.  It is so reasonably priced and the last one I had (before I gave it to the new adopter!) lasted and lasted.  It is nice also since the peek a boo openings on top are nicely trimmed with material.  I highly recommend this tunnel for cats and bunnies!  my cats often go into the buns pens and crawl through them as well.  Oh forgot to mention....there is a little hanging toy in the tunnel right at the opening and the buns had a ball with it...pulling it down and then playing with the toy.  The cat of course loved to bat it around.  Go get one of these...you will be glad you did!
summary: so much fun for my buns!

reviewText: It's always a good sign when I'm pouring the food from the bag into a bin in the kitchen and the dogs elbow each other trying to eat from the bin. I usually mix 2 kinds of food and, unfortunately, found that my black lab will pick through the food bowl and sling other brands across the room to get to this kind.

I gave this to my dog against my better judgment.  After all we sometimes eat junk food too.  If you have any knowledge of the way ingredients are listed you will notice that there are three different kinds of Soy in this food, I am sure if you add those up it will mean that soy is the main ingredient, not good. They claim it is chicken, not so, in my opinion.I will not even go near the digested meal.  Where is the meat?There is too much corn products in this, I feed my chickens corn and it is not the best for them either but it is whole.May I ask why food coloring?  It has been established that dogs do not perceive color, coloring is for our benefit, I see no reason to put it in our dog's food.Now my dog, I have a very healthy Pug, according to my vet even though he dislikes my feeding him an all raw meat diet.  I like to get some dog food just once in awhile to give as a treat when traveling, it is not easy carrying raw meat as a treat.My dog ate it, not with as much gusto as he does for some other treats. I feel I must say this, most dogs will eat just about anything you put in front of them, they have no clue what is good for them or not. Really, my dog used to eat chicken pooh before I took a stand on that so you see they will literally eat anything, some dogs eat cat pooh.I wish there was some way for us to taste it and know if it is good tasting.  One thing I know from my heart this is not the best food you can give your dog.Sorry Purina I think you will have to try a little harder.
My 8 month old lab pup has not been able to chew this one up!  this is a durable ball!

I only feed my doggies Blue, but I think this may be the first time trying the lamb. The absolutely love it, even the small doggy that usually just eats enough not to pass out! I have seen her go back for seconds and thirds! It is also cheaper here than in a brick and mortar. Try this flavor! =)
summary: My doggies are loving this lamb!

reviewText: After 3 years, I finally decided to get a booster seat for my 2nd yorkie.  My older one (15.5 lbs) is really good about staying in the back seat and is tall enough to look outside if wanted.  My 2nd yorkie feels the inside of the car is her personal playground.I was bit unsure about this product after reading the bad reviews (mostly regarding the odor) but read in the more current reviews that there was no noticeable odor.  There were no odor that I could tell.It was easy to put together and install and the material seemed decent.  If you're looking for a booster seat that won't break your bank, I'd definitely recommend this one.  The only thing you'd want to consider is the size.  I purchased the Medium small yorkie which I thought was perfect for her.  I know the product description says "up to 12 lbs" but unless you just want the dog to be able to sit in the seat, I'd think 7 lbs would be a good limit.
I love this litter, both of my rabbits are litter box trained and its so easy to clean up (and to know when its time to clean up!) Its a great deal on Amazon and it ships lighting fast.
Our pupply loves these Salmon treats. They are also good for his skin due to the fish oil in them.  They are pretty small but he enjoys them.

I bought two of these to add to my other four before going out of town. I have 4 cats and they need plenty of potty space. They are extra big with plenty of room for my larger cats. Really helped cut down on the odor and kept them from making a bigger mess while I was gone.

This is the only ball my dog will actually play fetch with.  She loves the material of the west paw design's.  This ball has as much bounce as one of those gumball sized bouncy balls, and it's a bit heavier so you might not want to toss this around valueables if you've got wood floors.
as the drinkwell fountain was so noisy that my cats wouldn't use it I gave these to a friend of mine but don't know if she used or not

My sister had a $80 Petco version of this that she gave me and I bought this one for the dog to have upstairs. This one is just as high quality, just as durable, and has al, the same features. Great buy!
summary: High Quality for a fraction of he price

reviewText: My goodness!  We now have 5 of these DoDo birds around the house.  We have a large dog who I believe can break a rock with her teeth.  She loves these.  We have had them for 2 months now and she hasn't torn them up and the squeakers have not broken.  We bought our first one from Amazon.  The next 3 came in a package from Costco.  We thought we could just save these until she destroyed the first.  However, she saw them in the box and would not allow us to put the rest away.  She loves choosing a different color every day. The last one came from our neighbor who loves to spoil her.  Our only complaint is tripping over them.

I've been giving these out to customers at our grooming shop for the last several days, and the response has been very positive.  Most dogs are anxious when they're at the shop, so very few will eat a treat.  However, I've had several dogs eagerly enjoy these while waiting to go home.  If a dog will eat these while waiting for their owner, they must be pretty darn good.
My five cats love this food,  They will eat it up and have never turned their nose up to it.

I will start with the cons.. The output end is not adjustable and kind of just hangs there with little control over the flow and where it goes. Makes a strong current that push the fish around. The flow rate is adjustable  but then i would not get the benefit of the full capacity of the filter if I lower it. I may spend extra and get the spray bar, which should come with it..Not as easy as a hang on back filters to change media etc but you get more capacity and options with canister filter.Also, the intake connector and out put connectors are white and stick out in the aquarium. I see the previous models were either a dark green or black, which blends in better. Why did they change it to white??Easy set up, watched the online demo on youtube and had it set up in less than 40 minutes.. Very well built and this model addressed some issue of the prior model, ie priming etc.It is totally silent as I can not hear it unless I open the stand and put my ear next to it..

Some jerky treats smell very strongly and can be greasy, these look good enough for people food and the dogs, especially my finicky standard poodle, love them.  They come vacuum packed and they suggest refrigeration after opening.  that isn't a big problem.  Good price for quality treats.

Excellent quality and works great. I got this for my AquaClear 50 powerhead. It installs easily, just pull of the existing intake and plug in. Cleans water quickly and efficiently, and inexpensive too!

As the title says, I don't know whether this product works or not because my dog was terrified of it and ran away whimpering! I hadn't considered that she may actually fear the spray when I bought it. If it works for your pets, I'm very glad. But if your animal is skittish, that is another thing to think about before purchasing.
summary: Have no idea whether it works of not

reviewText: I have been feeding this to my dog for a few months, having switched from another brand with a similar approach.  I never read the ingredients until today.  #1 ingredient is water.  #2 is wheat gluten.  Lamb and rice are a bit down the list.  We feed our dog a grain-free dry diet, because terriers are notorious for not doing well specifically with wheat.  A trip to the vet today for skin, urinary and digestive issues have identified the culprit. No more.
summary: Shame on me for not reading ingredients

reviewText: My dog LOVES these things, and this was the best price I found. Seriously, my dog is manic over these things. My only complaint: They are STINKY. Like really stinky. So prepare yourself. Or invest in some Febreeze. You've been warned.Good to know: These are the smaller, half sized bully sticks.
summary: Wish my dog didn't like these as much

reviewText: I purchased this for my 3 keets, I typically leave it in the cage 24/7, but I change out the water daily as it does become polluted really quickly. The keets love to look out the see-through dome, and enjoy splashing around in it. The only thing I would change is I would make it easier to only remove the water tray, as you need to remove the whole unit to clean.

My old dog had vestibular syndrome attack and the holistic vet gave us a sample of this stuff. I didn't think my dog would like it (it smells like veggies) but she loves it. I mix it with her food and she has perked up a lot and she looks great.

I just got a new puppy and the seller and I cut the puppy's hair together. When the buzzer gets to his face he hated it and it was difficult. I figured i would save on cuts like the seller and buy my own buzzer and do the same. Waited till fur grew back out and did it my self. It's a work in progress with my puppy, but as for the clipper I think it's A+ Cuts right thru his thick hair! Love it!
This stuff works and works great. Takes a few days but you will end up with water so clear the fish look like they are swimming in air.
I Have fed  my  13 year old cat  Purina cat food since he was a adult and I also have a 8 year old and a 18 month old cat and they love this food, no table food for them.
Had to search for the extra small option - works for my under 5 lb puppy. Fill it with cottage cheese and put it in the freezer. Teething toy. She'll chew on it for a while.

I am currently enrolled in an Animal Care Program at a local college and ordered this for my Boston Terrier after I learned this is the best harness to use when helping to leash train a dog. (I used the one with the D-Ring in the back, which doesn't help inhibit the forward pull motion).My dog will be 4 in October. He is about 23 pounds, which is a good size for a BT. He is great on the leash, but can get very excited and pull a lot when he sees other dogs and kids, or you know, a moving plastic bag.Anyway- this leash worked great! The instructions were easy to follow for fitting it properly to my dog. I did remove his actual collar when I walked him though, as his dog tag hangs a bit low and it was bumping into the D ring the whole time. He didn't pull at all and we had a very enjoyable walk. I'm glad I made the switch to this harness and would recommend to anyone, regardless of the size or age of your dog.
But they are stiff and don't feel as nice as the other ones I had that someone had given me. They are thin and feel flimsy but they work ok so can't really complain about function.

These make great and healthy treats for cats. All three of our cats go nuts over these flakes. You can buy bonito flakes for less as human food (they are used to make stock for soups like miso), but in my experience the human-food flakes are small and crushed up. The cats seem to enjoy the bigger flakes that come in the Cat-Man-Doo more than smaller flakes. The bottom of the Cat-Man-Doo container is never as exciting to them as the top. The container itself keeps the flakes sealed and fresh. There isn't any fishy smell until you actually open the container and give some to your kitties.It takes some cats a few times to figure out these are for eating, perhaps because of the flake texture. If your cat doesn't take to them right away, you can try putting some on or in their food or playing with one of the flakes so they pounce. Once tasted, the confused kitty gets that these are food and wants more.

My cats both go insane when I bring this toy out. I have to hide it when it's not play time because they will drag the stick around with the feather in their mouth. We have baby gates in our house and they will leap over the gate and the string will get stuck on the gate! Highly recommend to help with cats that have a lot of energy mine serious go nuts! Make sure to put it away when you are done so your cat can't reach it.  Definitely needs to be supervised while playing with,

I own the turtle and fish and even bought extra "eggs" because they are the ones with the squeakers!  Anyway, my dogs are aggressive chewers and they have not been able to tear through these toys.  It keeps them busy, trying to get the eggs out of the turtle.  I highly recommend.  Good quality.

If you have a smart dog (and based on experience, despite generalizations about breeds it's really about individual dogs), this is a good toy for the ones that like "hunting" things, playing fetch, and like all dogs do, treats. I put Bil-Jac little liver treats in this, and it's like a new toy for my dog every time she asks for it. She's figured out how to unscrew it if she wants to, but that's fine- most of the time she just enjoys chasing it around and getting the treats out. My experience is to set the white plastic adjustable hole to the smallest round shape possible, at least for these treats.
summary: Cute, inexpensive way to give your dog a toy & treat in one

reviewText: We have several of these Kyjen hide-a-toys. We have the turtle egg baby, the hide-a-squirrel and the hide-a-bee. There is almost something magical about these toys in the way that all three of my dogs instantly become engaged when they are refilled. Prior to owning these toys, my golden retriever was the bane to all things stuffed. Anything I gave her, she immediately went to work at destroying it and turning it inside out. Since we have had these toys, she is much gentler with her other stuffed toys. Now that we have three dogs, our youngest, a German Shepherd puppy, is also thoroughly enjoying these toys. Something about pulling the little animals and eggs out over and over again makes for endless fun. It's quite funny to watch them, too. They took some time to figure it out the first time, and I will admit, they do get quite good at it to the point where getting them out takes a minute, maybe two, and it's over. But it sure doesn't seem to take away from the fun of doing it again the next time. I would say if you're looking for something to keep your dog entertained while you are away or busy, this may not be it because of the constant need to put the animals/eggs back into the toy, but for some good simple fun with your dog, these are a fantastic toy and have the added benefit of curbing your dog's need to pull fluff out of everything that squeaks.

I use these extra large pads to protect my floors.  My many foster dogs who were rescued from puppy mills do their business where they are standing.  They are learning to go to the pads or outside in the fenced-in yard.  They are bright and willing to learn.  These pads are a great first step in their training.

The product was listed and pictured as a 8,000K (color rating) bulb. (the picture has changed several times in the last few days, just as the price has) However what I got is a bulb where the color isn't stamped on the box or the bulb and is different than the 8000k bulb I was trying to match.The actual color is more yellow than white, probably a 6500K bulb. Now, thanks to a seller that doesn't stay on top of his own inventory and doesn't seem to care whether or not his listing information is accurate, I have two bulbs with different colors.What? Now I have to go through the hassle of returning it or keep a bulb I'll probably never use. I'm ticked! (for want of a more accurate and colorful word!)

I got a sample of these freeze dried liver bits with an order through another website.  I liked them so much, I ordered more (they were cheaper on Amazon).  Most treats dry out after a day, but these are already dried so I can leave them out and they don't get gross.  And the dog loves them!!

This is absolutely the cheapest I have been able to find these, and with four cats of my own plus several foster cats, they are a must. This product doesn't affect every cat, but it does help most cats. I have found marked improvement in the temperament of one of my cats who has a tendency to bully. When tempers are flaring more than usual, I look down, and sure enough...my Feliway plug-in is empty! I keep it going in the foster rooms to help with anxiety since kitties are always coming and going and have usually been through a lot by the time they get to me.

Got bad idea written all over it .. a friend had 3 of these go bad one of them killed a 10000$ tank and he is still to dumb to stop using them ....UV bulbs under water,  pumps under water , and transformer under water. Made cheaply great way to lose a tank .to top it off 9 watt UV is a joke for most tanks.. just don't do it I know its a good price but its just not worth it  ThoseFishGeeks . Com

I bought this for the Princess of the Universe and she loved it.  For about an hour.  Since then she's played with it a couple times.  Mostly she ignores it.  It lacks the interactive people touch that can keep a toy interesting.so it's okay for a while.....
Best looking mat we've found and works amazingly well.  Thought I'd have to have the 'nappy' type to catch the litter but this one works great.  Cleans up really nice too.

I love these clippers so much with the rounded edges, and they are so sharp they cut cleanly and easily and I don't have to worry about nicking my girls...I am going to get myself a pair for my bangs that's just how much I like them...

When I first started feeding this product to my puppy, he loved it.  He eats it now, but not with the enthusiasm he originally displayed.  I am going to continue with this brand, but different varieties.

My dogs absolutely flip for this food - unfortunately I discovered one of my dogs has a grain allergy and so I've been feeding themthe grain-free version.As far as ingredients go, it's pretty quality stuff. (I'm not sure why the amazon ingredients list currently says "chocolate" - that's a dirty lie as there's none in here. The first five ingredients are chicken, chicken meal, brown rice, peas, and millet. Source: [...] )

This is a good dog leash (or I believe "lead" is the PC term these days--as if dogs register offense by which term we use). It's sturdy and it's holding up well. I couldn't use it when I first got my boxer because it was too heavy for her puppy neck. But a month or so in, she was strong enough that I could use it. As she's gotten remarkably stronger over the last 9 months, the leash is holding up well. I'd recommend this product.

I bought this because I didn't want to buy an air pump and deal with all the tubes going everywhere. I love that it has the added airation feature and works great in conjunction with my fluval 206 filter system. Not to mention that I'm treating for Ich right now and the airation helps with this a lot.Since I put this in, my one tank with no current takes a long time for the fish to rid their Ich but with this it takes less than a week.

The moment that I opened this jerky bag up, my dog went wild wanting to taste it. Since this is a healthy one, not sure he would like it but he loves it.Like that there are plenty in this bag and it seems to satisfy him more than the flat type of jerky!Highly recommend this jerky!
summary: Finally a healthy Jerky that my dog loves!

reviewText: This toy went fast. Great destructible chew toy. You can put food in the spheres for foraging. Also the toy seems to be made of safe materials.

Yes, this is another great dog treat. You dog will love it. Just do not mix with kibble because your dog will quickly begin to separate treat from kibble and will leave you with a pile of kibble on the floor in order to just enjoy the treat.
I read the dog magazine/article and all said that pumpkin is good for dog.  This is tasty too because my Pomeranian can't have enough.  This is soft so I can break it into 2 - 4 pieces.

I love this I was previously using the FURminator but i found out brushing with it took off my pups outer coat! Even though the furminator was great, It was a time for a change because it was removing the outer coat which didnt need removing. I asked other husky owners what they use and they told me to use a rake. This was the cheapest rake i found on amazon, and i was like why not give it a try. And oh my goodness, this is probably the best thing i've ever bought for grooming my husky WHO SHEDS ALL YEAR ROUND! but this is his first coat that he is blowing and this Rake removed all of the undercoat that needed to be removed and my husky loves this rake and so do i! Less hair around the house! I WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS TO ANY OWNER WITH A HUSKY OR ANY DOUBLE COAT DOG!

9 Lives Cat Food is one Meal my Cats really like and enjoy eating It. Daily Essentials Real Flaked Tuna in Sauce, one of the many Flavors that is Good for them and I get it Locally. 100% Completed and Balanced Nutrition with all kinds of Vitamins and Nutrients all supposed to be Good for Cats. I can get several Meals out of each Can of Food, my Cats are a little Finicky so I have to try different Flavors and Brands all the time. They enjoy eating it maybe twice a week, they don't eat a lot at one time, they are Nibblers and prefer to eat many little Meals. I have tried to give them other more expensive Cat Food from Popular "Specialty Pet Shops" or other "Food Boutiques" for Pets, however, they don't want any of that, they Crave and like eating 9 Lives. I am Glad there are such Diversity of Flavors to make my Cats Happy and to choose from. I even Feed 9 Lives to several Cats outside and they Love It! ...Thank You D.D.

These are the best training treats I have found.  They don't fall apart, or crumble when kept in the treat bag, they have a strong scent so the doggies love them, they are very small, so one is plenty - and they can last a while..  I have them on subscribe and save so I never run out…  The doggies seem to enjoy all flavors.  They are all natural with no artificial chemicals or preservatives, so this is one of the most important things for me.  great product

Have had several of these filters on different tanks. I like them. They have great flow rates per gallon and the large space in the back can also be used for other media. I see where other reviewers have stated that they are noisy but I have not had a problem with this.Also they run for a long time without problems. The bio wheel is a nice benefit as it collects a lot of good bacteria. This is one of my favorite back filters.

These pee pads are great for small dogs.  We have a small dog and we use these with a newspaper on top and they have worked great.  very absorbent.  The package only comes with 14 pads, and that is an odd number, I have gotten other packages in other stores with more in them, but these do work well.  I would recommend these, they did the trick.

I sometimes get notes from my cat Steve regarding his food, litter, toys etc. and I post them here. - - I know, its weirdDear Grocery Lady,Please don't think that I did not see and understand the "buy 1 get 1 free" coupon I saw for this terrible food. In case you didn't get the hint that I don't like this and you should never bring it again, I threw up in your shoe as gentle reminder.You know I have a delicate digestive system and a discerning palate.  Stick to the cuisine I like....don't go rogue again!Sincerely,Steve-the-cat  ,,,^. . ^,,,~

I was looking at the auto-cleaning litter boxes and came across this.  The motorized ones get a lot of bad reviews, so I was really interested in this design being manual but yet clean.  Just roll it over slowly, roll it back, tip it the other way a bit so the litter comes back into the tray and you're ready to empty the scoop.  It works great!  I was concerned about pieces getting stuck, but I haven't seen that happen yet.  You do need a little more floor space so you have room to roll it, but you could slide it and roll it if you don't have much space available.I made the mistake of over-filling it at first (used a full 40 pound bag), and that caused me to waste some litter since it all didn't fit in the sifting area and the extra went into the scoop.  Whoops. No big deal, lesson learned.
I know this is good quality food but...my Cherry-Head Conure hates it! I tried everything to make him eat it! he would rather starve! :(
summary: I know this is great food but...

reviewText: I know......it's JUST another cat box....right?  WRONG!  First of all, my kids CAN do it, and it was like a novelty item when we first got it, but I have since taken the chore back over.  FOr whatever reason......my picky cat (we have 2 kitties) would NOT go in the regular domed box that I cleaned and refilled with the SAME litter that I use in THIS box!  ....but after I got this box......he started using it!  He is reluctant to use it if the other, much larger cat, goes in and fills it up with his stuff........so I have to clean it at least once a week........BUT.......I LOVE this box!  I sometimes use the rolling technique....but my 20-Lb line-backer-cat has teh HUGEST pee-patties ever and sometimes it doesn't work.  I usually just scoop........but its a-ok-with-me.  :)  I love the pull-out feature to RE-deliver littler INTO the box......!!!!! :)  I think that its excellent.  :)  LOVE THIS BOX!  :)  ....we named it The Party Box....instead of Potty. :)

Awesome, very powerful and quiet and cool design. Very happy with this and awesome pump. Only defect is the two valves always blow air and I am only using one, so the other one just shoots out air into the cabinet.
summary: Great air pump, used for 6" bubble wall

reviewText: My 9 month old Maltipoo had a ball with this, until 5 minutes later she put a hole in it and began CHOKING on the plastic squeaker.  Good thing I never leave her alone with new toys.

I've never had a cat before. So I wasn't prepared when Felicia tripled in size at 3 months and started leaping squirrel-like from dresser to desk to the lamp next to the bed. Next, she'd be bouncing off the walls. I knew I just had to get her something for entertainment.Since I can't bear the thought of making the wrong purchase decision, I researched everything. This toy got some top ratings on Amazon, so it got my order. What a terrific little contraption it's turning out to be.From another room, I can hear the sound of the little ping-pong size ball rolling around the disc as Felicia swats it with her paw. It comes with a little pouch of catnip flakes, but I haven't used them; the cat is having such a blast without it. Why is this fun? Why does Felicia sit there batting it around and trying to catch it for 5 or 10 minutes at a time? What craving does this satisfy?Who cares. A month ago I would not have been able to type on the computer, as I'm doing now; Felicia would have been all over the keyboard, swatting at the screen, hurling herself compulsively around the room knocking over lamps and pencil cups. But today, the cat is a busy little bee. I can hear her in the kitchen attacking the pingpong ball.  Because you cannot plunk your cat in front of the TV like you can a 2 year old, this totally works for me.

reviewText: I gave this 4 stars because it's just my personal opinion that the smell is awful, but I hate it. HATE IT. it stinks! luckily it's not super strong and only lasts a day. My cats have a lot of dander in the winter and they are also fighting right now (one cat had surgery recently and smells of the vet; so they are in a fight to the death even though they've known each other their entire lives). I got this to not only make them smell the same so they would chill the f out but also to help with their dander (and to help keep the one clean that just had surgery; she's not really grooming herself as she heals).It seems to help with their dander and they don't mind it too too much (i just put a squirt or two in my hands and rub it on them). They try to lick it off their fur so it's good they're grooming but i am a bit perturbed by them just ingesting this stuff. The jury is still out as to whether they'll accept each other smelling like this stuff, but I'm going to use it again today and see how it tames their dander again. If it does another good job on that front, I'm happy to survive the smell, but otherwise I won't be using it much.
summary: Seems to help but i HATE the smell

Note: I understand this product is intended to be a treat and not a main source of food, but I still DO NOT recommend feeding your cat this product or products like it which contain a high percentage of grains and/or synthetic ingredients. Also, I suggest reading the following article pertaining to the dental health of cats: [...]Prior to purchasing products like this in the past I already knew that cats love flesh, but I had not paid much attention to the ingredients in the food - assuming, like most people, that since the food was made for cats, it must be healthy for them. While any food is better than no food, cat food which contains a high percentage of grains is pretty much useless to the cat consuming it. Cats are not herbivores or omnivores. They are carnivores.If you read the ingredients on this product and the other Feline Greenies dental treats flavors, you will see chicken meal, ground rice, ground wheat and corn gluten meal (likely from genetically modified corn), as the first four ingredients. Yes, the chicken meal is the first ingredient, but the fact that the next three are grains (or derivatives thereof) means a large percentage of the food is something your cat does NOT utilize very well.There are many articles from reputable sources that discuss the same things I have already mentioned. Here is an excerpt from one such article from [...] "Cats are obligate (strict) carnivores and are very different from dogs in their nutritional needs. What does it mean to be an `obligate carnivore'? It means that your cat was built by Mother Nature to get her nutritional needs met by the consumption of a large amount of animal-based proteins (meat/organs) and derives much less nutritional support from plant-based proteins (grains/vegetables). It means that cats lack specific metabolic (enzymatic) pathways and cannot utilize plant proteins as efficiently as animal proteins."Have a great day!

reviewText: I've been giving my dogs this Glucosamine with OptiMSM for years now and they are both in excellent health and I know it's helping their joints. It's a great product for great price!

I have four cats.  One cat is like a live wire and really needs to calm down. However, my other three are very calm (almost lethargic) with one of the three being geriatric.I selected this product for my one hyper cat.  I tried for several days to give them to him but he won't even eat half of one of the soft chews.  The first time I presented it to him he was very excited by the smell.  He looked like he was very interested in eating this as he quickly came down off his ceiling perch. However, I had no luck. I even tried putting it in his food and he ate around it.Because of all the warnings on the package, I was hesitant to try it on my other cats.  However, I decided to try it on them one time.  The others were also very enticed by the smell but only my 16 pound cat would eat one. The others walked away after smelling the soft chew. The one cat that ate it had absolutely no reaction at all and it's now been over one day. He also did not get any calmer that  he already is.As per the package,  the active ingredients of each chew are Thiamine (Vitamin B1) 31.25 mg, L-Theanine (Suntheanine brand) 10.56 mg, and Colostrum Calming Complex 5.28 mg.The ingredients are brewers yeast, calcium sulfate, canola oil, chicken liver flavor, citric acid, glycerin, maltodextrin, mixed tocopherols, propionic acid, rosemary extract, silicon dioxide, sodium alginate, soy lecithin, and vegetable oil.These are the cautions and warnings on the package:-  Safe use in pregnant animals or animals intended for breeding has not been proven.- If an animal's condition worsens or does not improve, stop product administration and consult your veterinarian.- For animal use only. (See contradictory statement below.)- Keep out of the reach of children and animals. Your pet may consider this a treat. In case of accidental overdose, contact a health professional immediately. (What this means to me is that your pet should not consider this a treat.)- For use in cats only.DIRECTIONS FOR USE: Up to 15 lbs. give one chew daily.  During times of increased stress, it is safe to double or triple this amount as needed.Based on the lack of interest by three of my four cats and the warnings above (taken from the package), I would not personally buy this product. I will mix it in with the used cat litter so that no other animal cat get to these. I have a friend who runs a shelter. Normally I would ask her to try products like this when my cats don't take to them; however, I just don't feel comfortable doing that with these chews.  If you have a hyper cat and you are considering this product because everything else has failed, then I guess it's worth a try.  Nevertheless, my recommendation would be to talk to your vet to see what he or she thinks of this soft chew for your particular pet before buying.
summary: The warnings on this product make me nervous and the cat that needs this won't eat them

reviewText: I have used just about every pet stain and pet odor removal product there is. Some haven't worked at all, some have worked okay, but none have worked well enough to completely remove the stain and odor so that they are completely gone. This product does. I highly recommend it.For this product, you get a 32-ounce bottle and two tablets. Each tablet makes 16 ounces, so you need to use two tablets to fill the bottle.However, there is a new version of the product: a 23-ounce bottle with new tablets that only require one tablet per bottle fill. You can get a bottle with an 8-tablet refill ("Fizzion Pet Stain & Odor Remover Refill Tablets (8 TABLETS) Makes 184oz Plus Refillable Bonus Fizzion 23oz Bottle").Also, if you are cleaning cat urine stains and want to use a UV light to detect them, I recommend the "Abco Tech 9 LED UV 375 nm 3 AAA" flashlight. (You'll need to supply three AAA batteries.) I've tried several UV lights that cost more than this one, and none worked anywhere nearly as well. I recently learned that the nm rating needs to be close to 370 in order for the light to clearly reveal the stains.
summary: Works great! Though there's a newer version

I hate to give this toy a low rating because my dog loves it so much, but it definitely has some flaws.  I've had mixed luck with Kong toys -- some of them, like the original chew toys and the SafeStix, are awesome and hold up well even when given to strong chewers, but this one is in pieces after less than a month.My dog is a 1-year-old Rottweiler who weighs a bit over 80 pounds.  She is one of the most destructive dogs I've ever had when it comes to toys.  She LOVES squeaky toys so, with some trepidation, I bought her this one.  For the first 2-3 weeks, this ring was actually all right.  I'd toss it, she'd retrieve it, and the squeaking kept her interest.And then it started coming apart.  This toy is joined in two places, directly across from each other.  On one side, a squeaker is concealed where the toy is joined.  At first, it started coming apart on the side where the squeaker is and I could push the squeaker back in.  But then, one day, I found that the squeaker had just disappeared.  It must've fallen out when my dog was running around the living room.  It hasn't turned up.  For all I know, my dog swallowed it!  (I'm not too concerned as she has "passed" some rather large objects in the past and she is not showing any signs of a blockage.)At any rate, shortly after the squeaker disappeared, the ring separated into two halves -- like big, blue pieces of elbow macaroni.  My dog still loves these two parts of the toy, and she hasn't managed to chew any pieces off of them yet, so I won't give this toy 1 star, but it lasted such a short time that it's not deserving of any more than two.  It's a pity; I had such high hopes for it.As always, supervise your dog with any new toy.  Due to the easy destruction of this one, don't leave your dog alone with it.

Be sure to keep the instructions!  Connecting to your faucet can be a bit tricky.  Initial 2 attempts were unsuccessful and very frustrating, was regretting purchase.  3rd attempt weeks later was able to hook to faucet and receive value from product.Overall, this is a tool beter suited for removing water & cleaning substrate than adding water.  You'll save tons of time and eliminate a lot of splashing when removing water and filling tank for complete tank overhauls.However, you can't treat your water before adding, so be careful you don't poison your fish by adding untreated/chlorinated tap water.
summary: A Little Tricky To Connect At First...

reviewText: She'll take a few laps, and then she won't touch the rest of it.  And if you leave it, it will mold over after several hours.  Eeeww!  It's an interesting idea, and would be good for dogs in warmer climates after a long bout of exercise.  But if your dog doesn't drink it all at one time, then you have to worry about storing it so it doesn't go bad.  And considering it's about a buck-fifty a packet, you certainly don't want to just throw it out!For me, the value isn't there.  If you want something like this for your dog, get the clear pedialyte.  Most stores carry a generic version, which will be very cost effective).  It's cheaper, doesn't have that funky smell, and she actually seems like it better.  Plus I can put just a little in her bowl at a time, I don't have to give her a full 12 ounces.This product just isn't economical.  Good in theory, poor in execution, and really poor in cost!
summary: She'll drink a little of it...

reviewText: This fipronil medicine is a breakthrough in pet care.  I researched the medical articles thoroughly to make sure it's safe for my dogs.  The research shows that this is one of the safest medicines on the market.  The fleas are COMPLETELY GONE!  I have never seen a single flea or tick on my dogs after using this product.  The review from the other person about sluggishness in their dog is jumping to conclusions based on a coincidence.  There is nothing in the medical research to indicate that would be a side effect.  There are no side effects other than temporary reddish skin at the site of application and even that was in a rare number of cases (skin can get irritated from just about anything).  The bottom line is that the fleas hate this product, and I love this product!
summary: Very safe and fleas or ticks on my dogs completely disappeared

reviewText: I think it must just depend on your cat.  Other people have raves about this product...my cat, however, looks at me like I am raving idiot when I try to get him to play/touch/look/smell this thing.  To say it's a total flop with him would be an understatement.
